int-org-section.heading: Social Welfare and Human Rights

alt-heading.usage: casee sacac ass mena sasia fea eerca
casee sacac ass mena sasia fea eerca

address.verbatim-address: Ecumenical Centre, 150 route de Ferney, 1211 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: the Alliance (`Action by Churches Together—ACT’) aims to bring together churches and orgs affiliated to the World Council of Churches and the Lutheran World Federation to improve the effectiveness of humanitarian assistance and work in support of sustainable devt
administrative offices are based in Geneva, Amman (Jordan), Bangkok (Thailand), Brussels (Belgium), San Salvador (El Salvador), Nairobi (Kenya) and New York (USA)
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 140 churches or related orgs in more than 120 countries

address.verbatim-address: Joseph Tito St, Kirkos Sub-City, Woreda 08, Nega City Mall, Addis Ababa 5111, Ethiopia

org-entry.content-note: aims to unify and amplify the voice of persons with disabilities, their families and orgs in Africa at national, regional and international levels
org-entry.stats: mems: 8 continental, 4 subregional, and 34 national DPO feds

address.verbatim-address: 93/1 rue Jean d'Outremeuse, 4020 Liege, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: aims to provide aid and support for refugees
founder Dominique Pire awarded the Nobel Prize for Peace (in 1958)

address.verbatim-address: 010000 Astana, Saryarka kosh. 6, Kazakhstan

org-entry.found-date: 2013—following the adoption in March 2011 of the AlmatI Declaration by a Regional Ministerial Conference on Refugee Protection and International Migration in Central Asia—to address multiple challenges resulting from complex migration dynamics and mixed migratory movements in Central Asia and beyond
org-entry.content-note: 2nd Regional Ministerial Conference on Refugee Protection and International Migration in Central Asia was convened within the framework of the Process in June 2013
the 6th AlmatI Process meeting of senior officials was convened in May 2021 (the inaugural meeting having been held in Nov. 2014)
org-entry.stats: core mems: Afghanistan, Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Türkiye, Turkmenistan; 2 observer countries (Iran, Pakistan)

address.verbatim-address: 1 Easton St, London, WC1X ODW, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: an independent, democratic, self-governing worldwide movement of people who campaign for internationally recognized human rights, such as those enshrined in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights

undertakes research and action focused on preventing and ending grave abuses of the rights to physical and mental integrity, freedom of conscience and expression, and freedom from discrimination, within the context of its work impartially to promote and protect all human rights
major policy decisions are taken by an International Council comprising representatives from all nat. sections
financed by donations; no funds are sought or accepted from govts
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 10m. individuals; nationally organized sections in more than 70 countries; other groups and networks (e.g. AI’s Urgent Action Network)
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , International Newsletter (monthly), The Wire (quarterly), country reports

address.verbatim-address: Thomas Clarkson House, The Stableyard, Broomgrove Rd, London, SW9 9TL, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: aims to eliminate all forms of slavery, such as bonded labour, child labour, human trafficking, early and forced marriage, slavery by descent; supports initiatives by local orgs to release people from slavery, and develops rehabilitation programmes aimed at preventing people from re-entering slavery; pressures govts to implement international laws prohibiting slavery and to develop and enforce similar national legislation
maintains digital collection of historical documentation on the transatlantic slave trade
publs Annual Review , Reporter (2 a year), special reports and research documentation

address.verbatim-address: Cairo, Egypt

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the active participation of Arab women in social, economic, cultural, and political life
works to develop income-generating projects for economically underprivileged women and to raise awareness of the impact of political and social inequality on the lives of Arab women
granted consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council in 1985

address.verbatim-address: The Market Bldg, 72-82 Rosebery Ave, London, EC1R 4RW, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: an international human rights org., in particular dedicated to defending and promoting freedom of expression and of information

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Associated Country Women of the World (ACWW)

address.verbatim-address: The Foundry, 17 Oval Way, London, SE11 5RR, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: aims to aid the economic and social devt of countrywomen and homemakers of all nations, to promote international goodwill and understanding, to work to alleviate poverty, and promote good health and education
holds triennial conf. (2023: Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur, in May)
publ. The Countrywoman (quarterly)

org-entry-head.alt-name: International Association of Mutual Benefit Societies

address.verbatim-address: 50 rue d'Arlon, 5th Floor, 1000 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: as a grouping of autonomous health insurance and social protection bodies, aims to promote and reinforce access to health care by developing the sound management of mutualities
serves as a forum for the exchange of information and debate
publs AIMS (newsletter), reports on health issues

address.verbatim-address: Orly Fret 768, 94398 Orly Aérogare Cedex, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to make available the resources of the aviation industry to humanitarian orgs, for carrying supplies and equipment at minimum cost, both on long-distance flights and locally
provides logistic support to 180 orgs
publs Newsletter , La Lettre (in French), Activity Report (annually)

address.verbatim-address: Gonzagagasse 1, 1010 Vienna, Austria

org-entry.content-note: serves as an informal consultative forum, principally for European and neighbouring eastern states, on issues related to migration, incl. best practices and other information
adopted in April 2013 the Istanbul Ministerial Declaration on `A Silk Routes Partnership for Migration’

org-entry-head.alt-name: International Confederation of Catholic Organizations for charitable and social action

address.verbatim-address: Palazzo San Calisto, 00120 Città del Vaticano

org-entry.content-note: studies prob­lems arising from poverty, their causes and possible solutions
national mem. orgs undertake assistance and devt activities
co-ordinates emergency relief and devt projects, and represents mems at international level
holds a Gen. Assembly every 4 years (2023: Rome, Italy, in May)
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 162 nat. orgs in 7 regions
org-entry.content-note: publs Caritas Brochure , Annual Reports

address.verbatim-address: 25 Owl St, 6th Floor, Johannesburg 2092, South Africa

org-entry.content-note: aims to protect and strengthen citizen action and civil society throughout the world, in particular in areas where participatory democracy and citizen freedoms are threatened
convenes a World Assembly annually

address.verbatim-address: Siddharta Chambers 1, Third Floor, 55 a Kalu Sarai, New Delhi, 110 016, India

org-entry.content-note: aims to further human rights education and advocacy, and to document human rights violations and progressive efforts in the South Asian countries of the Commonwealth
accredited to the Commonwealth and has Observer Status with the African Commission on Human and Peoples' Rights (since 2002)
granted consultative status with the UN Economic and Social Council in 2005
publ. Newsletter

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Coordinating Committee for International Voluntary Service (CCIVS)

address.verbatim-address: Maison de l'UNESCO, 1 rue Miollis, 75015 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: co-ordinates international voluntary service orgs worldwide; organizes seminars and confs
publishes relevant literature
undertakes planning and execution of projects in collaboration with orgs including UNESCO, the UN, the European Union and the Council of Europe

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Co-ordinator of the Indigenous Organizations of the Amazon Basin (COICA)

address.verbatim-address: Calle Sevilla N24-358 y Guipuzcoa, La Floresta, Quito, Ecuador

org-entry.content-note: aims to co-ordinate the activities of national orgs concerned with the Indigenous people and environment of the Amazon basin, and promotes respect for human rights and the self-determination of the Indigenous populations
publ. Nuestra Amazonia (quarterly, in English, Spanish, French and Portuguese)

address.verbatim-address: Engerser Str. 81, 56564 Neuwied, Germany

org-entry.content-note: undertakes professional training, apprenticeship pro­gs and devt work in support of co-operatives in Africa and Latin America
conducts conflict resolution activities
runs volunteer progs in co-operation with peace groups in Europe and the USA
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 260 individual mems and 6 institutional

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: European Council for Tolerance and Reconciliation (ECTR)

address.verbatim-address: 200/7 ave de Messidor, 1180 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.found-date: 2008; activities suspended in April 2022 following the imposition of sanctions by the UK Govt against the ECTR founder and Pres. Moshe Kantor, as a result of his perceived close connection to Russia’s Pres. Putin
org-entry.content-note: committed to combating combat racism, xenophobia and anti-Semitism and to promoting tolerance and reconciliation through education and leadership
awarded European Medals of Tolerance and a Kantor Prize for Secure Tolerance

address.verbatim-address: Lečkova 1520, 149 00 Prague 4, Czech Republic

org-entry.found-date: 1962 as the European Federation for the Welfare of the Elderly, present name adopted in 2002
org-entry.content-note: serves as a forum for the exchange of experience and practical co-operation among mem. orgs
represents the interests of mems before international orgs
promotes understanding and co-operation in matters of social welfare
draws attention to the problems of old age
publ. Newsletter

address.verbatim-address: 25 Hangang-daero, 21-Gil, Yongsan-Gu, Seoul 140-880, Republic of Korea

org-entry.content-note: aims to enhance closer relations and collaboration among Asians, particularly women, through mutual appreciation of cultural, moral and socioeconomic values
holds biennial convention
publ. FAWA News Bul­le­tin ­(quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: 350 Fifth Ave, 34th Floor, New York, NY 10118-3299, USA

org-entry.content-note: investigates and reports on abuses of human rights worldwide
advocates for changes to and enforcement of relevant legislation, policies and practices
comprises country specialists, academics, lawyers, advocates and journalists

address.verbatim-address: 3 ave des Arts , 1210 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: aims to advance the human rights and defend the interests of people with learning or intellectual disabilities, and their families, in Europe
publs INCLUDE , Europe for Us (every 2 months), other papers and publs

address.verbatim-address: La Loge, 106 route de Ferney, 1202 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.found-date: 1938 as the Moral Rearmament Movement (a successor to the Oxford Group, f. 1929); present name adopted in 2001
org-entry.content-note: promotes peace and trust between divided communities

address.verbatim-address: Calle San Ramón s/n Col. San Jeronimo Lidice Alcaldía La Magdalena Contreras, CP 10200, Ciudad de México, Mexico

org-entry.content-note: works to contribute to the devt of social security in the countries of the Americas and to co-operate with social security institutions

CISS bodies are the General Assembly, the Permanent Inter-American Committee on Social Security, the Secre­tariat General, 6 American Commissions of Social Security, and the Inter-American Center for Social Security Studies
publs Social Security Journal/Seguridad Social (every 2 months), The Americas Social Security Report (annually), Social Security Bulletin (monthly, online), monographs, study series

address.verbatim-address: c/o AAS, 5221 Wisconsin Ave, NW, Washington DC 20015, USA

org-entry.content-note: serves as a common platform for interchange of acquired experience, literature and information about suicide
disseminates information
arranges special training
encourages and carries out research
organizes the Biennial International Congress for Suicide Prevention (2023: Piran, Slovenia, in Sept.)
org-entry.stats: mems: 800 individuals and socs, in 79 countries of all continents
org-entry.content-note: publ. Crisis (every 2 months)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Schools of Social Work

address.verbatim-address: Rm 212, School of Social Work, Tata Institute of Social Sciences, V. N. Purav Marg, Opp. Deonar Depot, Mumbai 400 088, India

org-entry.content-note: aims to provide international leadership and encourage high standards in social work education
org-entry.stats: mems: 606 schools, some 121 individual mems, 6 affiliates
org-entry.content-note: publs Newsletters (in English, French and Spanish), Directory of Schools of Social Work , Journal of International Social Work , Social Dialogue Magazine , reports and case studies

address.verbatim-address: Brolaeggerstr. 9-11, 1211 Copenhagen, Denmark

org-entry.found-date: 1951, as International Asscn of Workers for Troubled Children and Youth
org-entry.content-note: provides a centre of information about child welfare
encourages co-operation between mems

address.verbatim-address: Lindenrain 5 a , 3012 Bern, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: supports those affected by drug addiction and alcoholism
publ. Annual Report

address.verbatim-address: POB 96, 1 rue de Varembé, 1211 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: serves and protects uprooted people, regardless of faith, race, ethnicity or nationality
maintains staff and progs in more than 50 countries; advocates for rights-based policies and sustainable solutions

address.verbatim-address: POB 172, 10-12 chemin de Surville, 1213 Petit-Lancy 2, Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to contribute to the devt of structures ensuring the protection of populations and the safeguarding of property and the environment in the face of natural and man-made disasters
promotes co-operation between civil defence orgs in mem. countries
org-entry.stats: mems: 60 mem. states, 16 observer states and 21 affiliated mems
org-entry.content-note: publ. International Civil Defence Journal (quarterly, in Arabic, English, French, Russian and Chinese)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Commission for the Prevention of Alcoholism and Drug Dependency

address.verbatim-address: 12501 Old Columbia Pike, Silver Spring, MD 20904-6600, USA

org-entry.content-note: promotes scientific research on intoxication by alcohol, its physiological, mental and moral effects on the individual, and its effect on the community
publ. ICPA Reporter

address.verbatim-address: 26-28 ave Guiseppe Motta, 1202 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: serves as a global network of human rights and humanitarian NGOs
focuses on information exchange and advocacy, primarily in the areas of humanitarian affairs and refugee issues
org-entry.stats: mems: 160 NGOs in active in 160 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , newsletter, brochures and bulletins available online

address.verbatim-address: 19 rue Vignon, 75008 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to bring together National Councils of Women from all continents, for consultation and jt action
promotes equal rights for men and women and the integration of women in devt and decision making
has 5 standing cttees
publ. Newsletter

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council on Alcohol and Addictions (ICAA)
org-entry-head.alt-name: Conseil international sur les problèmes de l’ alcoolisme et des toxicomanies

address.verbatim-address: CP 189, 1001 Lausanne, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: provides an international forum for all those concerned with the prevention of harm resulting from the use of alcohol and other drugs
offers advice and guidance in devt of policies and programmes
organizes training courses, con­gresses, symposia and seminars in different countries
org-entry.stats: mems: affiliated orgs in 74 countries, as well as individual mems

address.verbatim-address: Departamento de Trabajo Social, Facultad de Derecho, Catedrático de Universidad, Obispo Trejo 2, 28040 Madrid, Spain

org-entry.content-note: facilitates the discussion of social work and related issues and promotes interest in social welfare
holds international conf. every 2 years with the International Association of Schools of Social Work and the International Federation of Social Workers
provides documentation and information services
org-entry.stats: mems: 27 nat. cttees, 7 int. orgs, 33 other orgs in 87 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. Global Social Policy Journal (3 a year)

address.verbatim-address: c/o R.V.Steensma, Van Diepenburchstraat 166, 2597 PZ The Hague, Netherlands

org-entry.found-date: 1958 to perpetuate the memory of the political prisoners of Dachau
org-entry.content-note: to manifest the friendship and solidarity of former prisoners whatever their beliefs or nationality
to maintain the ideals of their resistance, liberty, tolerance and respect for persons and nations
and to maintain the former concentration camp at Dachau as a museum and international memorial

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation for Human Rights Leagues (FIDH)

address.verbatim-address: 17 passage de la Main d'Or, 75011 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: promotes the implementation of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and other instruments of human rights protection
aims to raise awareness and alert public opinion to issues of human rights violations
undertakes investigation and observation missions
carries out training
uses its consultative and observer status to lobby international authorities
Congress held every 3 years (41st: Paris, France, in Oct. 2022)
org-entry.stats: mems: 188 nat. leagues in over 112 countries

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Persons with Physical Dis­ability (FIMITIC)

address.verbatim-address: 237 ave de Tervueren, 1150 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: serves as an inter­national, humanitarian, non-profit, politically and religiously neutral non-governmental umbrella fed. of persons with physical disability under the guidance of the dis­abled themselves

focuses activities on ensuring the equalization of opportunities and full participation of persons with physical disabilities in society and combats any kind of discrimination against persons with disabilities
org-entry.stats: mems: 14 nat. groups from 11 European countries

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC)

address.verbatim-address: POB 303, 1211 Geneva 19, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to prevent and alleviate human suffering
conducts relief operations for refugees and victims of disasters, co-ordinates relief supplies and assists in disaster prevention
supports humanitarian activities by national Red Cross and Red Crescent societies
publs Annual Report , Red Cross Red Crescent (quarterly), Weekly News , World Disasters Report , Emergency Appeal

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC)

address.verbatim-address: POB 303, 1211 Geneva 19, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to prevent and alleviate human suffering
conducts relief operations for refugees and victims of disasters, co-ordinates relief supplies and assists in disaster prevention
supports humanitarian activities by national Red Cross and Red Crescent societies
major appeals underway as at June 2023 included 800m. Swiss francs to support 22.6m. people in Ukraine and in nearby countries impacted by the Russian Federation-Ukraine conflict
publs Annual Report , Red Cross Red Crescent (quarterly), Weekly News , World Disasters Report , Emergency Appeal

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC)

address.verbatim-address: POB 303, 1211 Geneva 19, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to prevent and alleviate human suffering
conducts relief operations for refugees and victims of disasters, co-ordinates relief supplies and assists in disaster prevention
supports humanitarian activities by national Red Cross and Red Crescent societies
major appeals underway as at June 2023 included 100m. Swiss francs and 350m. Swiss francs to support the survivors of earthquakes that in Feb. had devastated parts of, respectively, Syria and Türkiye
publs Annual Report , Red Cross Red Crescent (quarterly), Weekly News , World Disasters Report , Emergency Appeal

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC)

address.verbatim-address: POB 303, 1211 Geneva 19, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to prevent and alleviate human suffering
conducts relief operations for refugees and victims of disasters, co-ordinates relief supplies and assists in disaster prevention
supports humanitarian activities by national Red Cross and Red Crescent societies

pan-African conferences of national Red Cross and Red Crescent societies are convened periodically under the joint auspices of the IFRC and the host government (9th conf.: Abidjan, Côte d’Ivoire, in April 2017)

major appeals underway as at June 2023 included 132m. Swiss francs to assist 7.6m. people suffering food insecurity across Africa; and 60m. Swiss francs to fund humanitarian assistance in Sudan, where large-scale civil conflict had erupted in April, and also a further 33.5m. to support the emergency response in affected neighbouring countries
publs Annual Report , Red Cross Red Crescent (quarterly), Weekly News , World Disasters Report , Emergency Appeal

address.verbatim-address: Maiengässli 4, 4310 Rheinfelden, Switzerland

org-entry.found-date: 1928 as International Permanent Secretariat of Social Workers; present name adopted in 1956
org-entry.content-note: aims to promote social work as a profession through international co-operation on stand­ards, training, ethics and working conditions
organizes international confs
represents the profession at the UN and other international bodies
supports national asscns of social workers
publs IFSW Update (available online), policy statements, manifestos

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International League against Racism and Antisemitism
org-entry-head.alt-name: La Ligue Internationale contre le Racisme et l'Antisémitisme—LICRA

address.verbatim-address: 42 rue du Louvre, 75001 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: campaigns against all forms of racism in all sectors of society, incl. sport, culture, education, law

address.verbatim-address: 352 Seventh Ave, Suite 1234, New York, NY 10001, USA

org-entry.content-note: mandated to implement political, civil, social, economic and cultural rights contained in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights adopted by the UN and to support and protect defenders of human rights worldwide
maintains offices in Geneva, Switzerland, and in Freetown, Sierra Leone
mems: individuals, nat. affiliates and correspondents throughout the world
publs various human rights reports

address.verbatim-address: 4 Newhams Row, London, SE1 3UZ, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote and support sexual and reproductive health rights and choices worldwide, with a particular focus on the needs of young people
works to bring relevant issues to the attention of the media, parliamentarians, academics, governmental and non-governmental orgs, and the general public
mobilizes financial resources to fund programmes and information materials
offers technical assistance and training
collaborates with other international orgs; the International Medical Panel of the IPPF formulates guidelines and statements on current medical and scientific advice and best practices

address.verbatim-address: 122 East 42nd St, New York, NY 10168-1289, USA

org-entry.content-note: supports people whose lives and livelihoods are devastated by conflict and disaster to survive, recover, and gain control of their future

address.verbatim-address: 6 ave des Arts, Saint Josse-ten-Noode, 1210 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: aims to help adult scouts and guides to keep alive the spirit of the Scout and Guide Promise and Laws and to bring that spirit into the communities in which they live and work
promotes liaison and co-operation between national orgs for adult scouts and guides
publ. ISGF Newsletter (2 a year)

address.verbatim-address: 4 route des Morillons, CP 1, 1211 Geneva 22, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: established to promote the devt of social security throughout the world, mainly through the improvement of techniques and administration, in order to advance social and economic conditions on the basis of social justice

collects and disseminates information on social security programmes throughout the world; undertakes research and policy analysis on the social security issues and distributes their results; encourages mutual assistance between mem. orgs; facilitates good practice collection and exchange; co-operates with other international or regional orgs exercising activities related to the field; communicates with its constituency and media and promotes social security through advocacy and information; and forges partnerships between the ISSA and other international orgs active in the area of social security to advance common strategies, including the ILO, the OECD and the World Bank
an ISSA Focal Point for French-speaking Countries was inaugurated in March 2022

organizes a World Social Security Forum (2022: Marrakesh, Morocco, in Oct.) and 4 Regional Social Security Forums; convenes topic-related technical seminars in various regions; hosts international confs, for example on information and communication technology in social security, social security actuaries and statisticians, and international policy research; co-organizes the World Congress on Occupational Safety and Health every 3 years
org-entry.stats: mems: some 350 institutions in over 160 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Review , International Social Security Review (quarterly), Priorities for Social Security Global 2022 , policy briefings, technical reports

address.verbatim-address: 32 quai du Seujet, 1201 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: established to aid families and individuals whose problems require services beyond the boundaries of the country in which they live, and where the solution of these problems depends upon co-ordinated action on the part of social workers in 2 or more countries
studies from an international standpoint the conditions and consequences of emigration in their effect on the individual, family and social life
operates on a non-sectarian and non-political basis
runs the International Reference Centre for children deprived of family and analyses trends in national and international adoption
org-entry.stats: mems: 13 brs and 4 affiliated bureaux; correspondents in more than 120 countries

address.verbatim-address: Borsigallee 9, 60388 Frankfurt am Maine, Germany

org-entry.content-note: promotes fundamental human rights and religious freedom
publs Für die Menschenrechte (monthly), Newsletter , Menschenrechte (quar­terly)

address.verbatim-address: Box 7514, 10392 Stockholm, Sweden

org-entry.content-note: works to safeguard the interests of tenants
participates in activities of UN-Habitat
has working groups for EC matters, Eastern Europe, developing countries and for future devt
holds biannual council meeting and triennial world conference
publ. The Global Tenant (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: 300 West 22nd St, Oak Brook, IL 60523-8842, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to foster understanding among people of the world, to promote principles of good govt and citizenship and an interest in civic, cultural, social and moral welfare and to encourage service-minded people to serve their community without financial reward
org-entry.stats: mems: 1.4m. in over 46,000 clubs in 200 countries and geographic areas
org-entry.content-note: publ. The Lion (10 a year, in 20 languages)

org-entry.usage: casee eerca sacac mena fea sasia ass ewyb edio

address.verbatim-address: 140 route de Ferney, 1202 Geneva 21, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: independent medical humanitarian org. composed of physicians and other mems of the medical profession
aims to provide medical assistance to victims of war and natural disasters
operates longer-term progs of nutrition, immunization, sanitation, public health, and rehabilitation of hospitals and dispensaries
awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1999
org-entry.stats: mems: 26 asscns in more than 69 countries worldwide
org-entry.content-note: publs International Activity Report (annually), Dispatches (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: 23 ave de France, Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to provide assistance to agencies and institutions with the management of mixed migration
conducts research and analysis on migration flows and estimates (incl. through the Mixed Migration Monitoring Mechanism initiative—the 4Mi), and co-ordinates humanitarian assistance
aims to stimulate debate and foster policy devt on mixed migration
regional hubs provide focused research, and cover Asia, East Africa and Yemen, Europe, Latin America and the Caribbean, the Middle East, North Africa, and West Africa
publs Mixed Migration Review (annually), research papers, thematic reports

address.verbatim-address: POB 18458, Suva, Fiji

org-entry.content-note: established to foster regional co-operation in addressing issues related to disability for the benefit of affected persons
aims to build awareness and pool resources among regional orgs to work for the rights and dignity of people with disabilities
organizes a Pacific Disability Regional Conference (2019: Nadi, Fiji, in Feb.)
org-entry.stats: mems: 72 orgs in 22 pacific island countries

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Pan-Pacific and South East Asia Women's Association (PPSEAWA)

address.verbatim-address: 9/116 Soi 2/2 Panya Ram Indra Community, Panya Indra Rd, Khanna Yao, Bangkok 10230, Thailand

org-entry.content-note: established to foster better understanding and friendship among women in the region, and to promote co-operation for the study and improvement of social conditions
holds international conf., normally, every 3 years (2019: Taiwan, in June)
publ. PPSEAWA Bulletin (2 a year)

address.verbatim-address: Global Hub: Dukes Court, Block A , Duke St, Woking, Surrey GU21 5BH, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: advocates for equal opportunities worldwide
aims to empower girls to advocate for their rights, and to encourage and empower boys and young men to respect girls and women, and to become allies of the global girls’ rights movement
promotes free, equal access to quality education and skills development for all children
works to protect children from violence
works to enable vulnerable children to understand and to defend their rights
promotes sexual and reproductive health and rights
maintains a global hub (UK), 4 regional hubs, 50 country offices, and 4 liaison offices

address.verbatim-address: 1 Dag Hammarskjöld Plaza, New York, NY 10017, USA

org-entry.content-note: the Council is organized into 3 programmes: HIV and AIDS; Poverty, Gender, and Youth; and Reproductive Health
aims to improve reproductive health and achieve a balance between people and resources
analyses demo­graphic trends
conducts biomedical research to develop new contraceptives
works with private and public agencies to improve the quality and scope of family planning and reproductive health services
helps govts to design and implement population policies
communicates results of research

maintains a global network of offices, with programmes in more than 50 countries; an office in Washington, DC, USA, carries out worldwide operational research and activities for reproductive health and the prevention of HIV and AIDS
publs Momentum (2 a year), Studies in Family Planning (quarterly), Population and Development Review (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: Gonzagagasse 1, 1010 Vienna, Austria

org-entry.found-date: 2009 as a dialogue process promoting migration partnerships among the mem. states of the EU, Schengen Area, Eastern Partnership, Western Balkans, Central Asia, Russian Fed. and Türkiye
org-entry.content-note: activities cover preventing and combating illegal migration; promoting readmission, voluntary return, and sustainable reintegration; addressing legal migration and mobility, with a particular focus on labour migration; promoting the integration of legally residing migrants in host societies; making migration and mobility positive forces for devt; and asylum and international protection
publ. Quarterly Review

address.verbatim-address: 1101 14th St, NW, Suite 1100, Washington, DC 20005, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to provide emergency relief, rehabilitation and devt assistance to people suffering as a result of social conflict or natural disaster

address.verbatim-address: 1560 Sherman Ave, Evanston, IL 60201, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to carry out activities for the service of humanity, to promote high ethical stan­dards in business and professions and to further international understanding, goodwill and peace
org-entry.stats: mems: 1.4m. in some 46,000 Rotary Clubs in more than 200 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs The Rotarian (monthly, English), Rotary World Magazine (5 a year, in 9 languages)

address.verbatim-address: Belgiëlei 37, 2018 Antwerp, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote peace and under­standing through voluntary service projects
more than 12,000 volunteers participate in SCI volunteer projects worldwide each year
SCI is also active in the field of peace education and organizes seminars, training activities and meetings
publ. Annual Report

address.verbatim-address: 302 Albert Rd, Woodstock, 7925 Cape Town, South Africa

org-entry.content-note: a transnational network of community-based orgs of the urban poor
org-entry.stats: mems: affiliates in more than 18 countries

address.verbatim-address: Bumpers Way, Bumpers Farm, Chippenham, Wiltshire, SN14 6NG

org-entry.found-date: 1950; name changed from Royal Commonwealth Society for the Blind to present name in 1986
org-entry.content-note: works to prevent blindness and restore sight in developing countries, and to provide education and community-based training for incurably blind people
operates in collaboration with local partners in some 30 developing countries, with high priority given to training local staff
publ. Sightsavers News

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Society of Saint Vincent de Paul

address.verbatim-address: 65 rue de la Glacière, 75013 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: a lay Catholic organization

undertakes charitable activities such as childcare, youth work, work with immigrants, adult literacy progs, residential care for the sick, handicapped and elderly, social counselling and work with prisoners and the unemployed, through personal contact
publ. Newsletter (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: 50 ave des Arts, Bte 5, 1000 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.found-date: 1948 (fmrly International Workers' Aid), present name adopted in 1995
org-entry.content-note: network of NGOs working to advance social justice in Europe and worldwide
administers the SOLIDAR Foundation to support life-long learning
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 50 orgs based in 26 countries

address.verbatim-address: 8 a Romsey Terrace, Cambridge, CB1 3NH, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: unites professional and business women in promoting a world in which women and girls may achieve their individual and collective potential, attain equality, and establish strong, peaceful communities worldwide; aims, through a global network of mems and international partnerships, to inspire action, and to create opportunities, that might transform the lives of women and girls
convention held every 4 years (2023: Dublin, Ireland, in July)
org-entry.stats: mems: about 66,000 in 120 countries and territories
org-entry.content-note: publ. Soroptimist International (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: c/o Oficina Regional de la OIM para América del Sur, Avda Callao 1033, 3°, C1023AAD Buenos Aires, Argentina

org-entry.content-note: the 10th SCM, held in Cochabamba, Bolivia, in Oct. 2010, adopted a Declaration of Migration Principles and Guidelines and a South American Action Plan on Human Development and Migration, which aims to strengthen border management, migration management, migrant rights, information resources on immigration
18th SCM: held in Nov. 2018, in Sucre, Bolivia, on the theme `The inclusion and integration of migrants beyond territorial borders’
the SCM Technical Secretariat (hosted by the IOM Regional Office for South America) manages support mechanisms for monitoring the Action Plan and other SCM initiatives and activities

address.verbatim-address: 3 chemin du Pré-Picot, 1223 Cologny/Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: advocates for child welfare and aims to raise public and political awareness
co-ordinates the activities of orgs to develop and implement policies or projects designed to improve the living conditions of disadvantaged children, their families and communities
granted consultative status with the UN Economic and Social Council, the UN, UNICEF, the ILO and the Council of Europe
org-entry.stats: mems: 9 nat. orgs in Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Spain and Switzerland

address.verbatim-address: rue Aram, Lot 14, Secteur 7, Hay Riad, Rabat, Morocco

org-entry.content-note: promotes co-operation among African companies concerned with health care and social insurance

address.verbatim-address: 588 Broadway, Suite 210, New York, NY 10012, USA

org-entry.content-note: collates data, supports research and advocates for change in support of gender equality and sexual and reproductive health and rights
launched Deliver for Good campaign in 2016 to promote implementation of gender-related SDG targets
administers a Young Leaders prog. and a Humanitarian Advocacy prog. (piloted in Lebanon in 2018)
organizes a global conf. every 3 years (2023: Kigali, Rwanda, in July)

address.verbatim-address: 2000 M St, NW, Suite 200, Washington, DC 20036, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to assist the recovery and rehabilitation of women in conflict and post-conflict environments, in order to promote sustainable and peaceful socs

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Women’s Global Network for Reproductive Rights

address.verbatim-address: 3 Marunong St, Barangay Central, Diliman, Quezon City 1100, Philippines

org-entry.content-note: promotes and works for sexual and reproductive health, rights and justice for women and all marginalized groups
publs e-Newsletter (monthly), position papers and annual reports

address.verbatim-address: 1929 Bayview Ave, Toronto, ON M4G 3E8, Canada

org-entry.found-date: 1984 (amalgamating the World Council for the Welfare of the Blind and the International Federation of the Blind)
org-entry.content-note: works on the prevention and cure of blindness in co-operation with the International Agency for the Prevention of Blindness
supports the welfare of blind and visually impaired people
encourages devt of braille, talking book progs and other media for the blind
organizes rehabilitation, training and employment
co-ordinates aid to the blind in developing countries
maintains the Louis Braille birthplace (in Coupvray, France) as an international museum
publ. E-Bulletin (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: 28 pl. Saint-Georges, 75009 Paris, France

org-entry.found-date: 1947 as the International Union of Family Orgs, present name adopted in 1998
org-entry.content-note: maintains commissions and working groups on issues including standards of living, housing, marriage guidance, rural families
there are 6 regional orgs: in Rabat, Morocco; Montréal, Canada; Tunis, Tunisia; New Delhi, India; Bern, Switzerland; and Curitiba, Brazil
org-entry.stats: mems: nat. asscns in more than 180 countries

address.verbatim-address: POB 65, 00401 Helsinki, Finland

org-entry.content-note: serves the interests of deaf people and their national orgs and represents these at international level
works towards the goal of full participation by deaf people in society
encourages deaf people to set up and run their own orgs
priority is given to the promotion of the recognition and use of national sign languages, the education of deaf people and deaf people in the developing world
organizes a World Congress every 4 years (2023: Jeju, Rep. of Korea, in July)
publ. WFD Newsletter (6 a year)

address.verbatim-address: ORT House, 147 Arlington Rd, London NW1 7ET, United Kingdom

org-entry.found-date: 1880 for the devt of industrial, agricultural and artisanal skills among Jewish people
org-entry.content-note: promotes science and technology for children and adults, including instructors' and teachers' education and apprenticeship training; implements tech­nical assistance progs in co-operation with interested govts
manages global network of schools, colleges, training centres and progs
publs Annual Report , World ORT Times

address.verbatim-address: Support Office: Rua General Jardim 660, 7° andar, São Paulo, Brazil 01223-010

org-entry.found-date: 2001 as a regular global meeting of civil society bodies; a Charter of Principles was adopted in June 2002
org-entry.content-note: aims to pursue alternatives to neo-liberal policies and commercial globalization; its objectives include the devt and promotion of democratic international systems and institutions serving social justice, equality and the sovereignty of peoples, based on respect for the universal human rights of citizens of all nations and for the environment

an International Council, comprising more than 150 civil society orgs and commissions, guides the Forum and considers general political questions and methodology; the Support Office in São Paulo provides administrative assistance to the Forum process, to the International Council and to the specific organizing cttees for each biannual event
2021 WSF: online, in Jan.
the 8th edition of a related WSF on Migrations (WSFF, first staged in 2005) was convened in Mexico City, Mexico, in Nov. 2018
org-entry.stats: mems: civil society orgs and movements worldwide

address.verbatim-address: 1 rue de la Cité, 1204 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to help to implement the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and related inter­national conventions and to defend the spiritual and material interests of war veterans and war victims
promotes practical international co-operation in disarmament, legislation concerning war veterans and war victims, and devt of international humanitarian law
maintains regional cttees for Africa, Asia and the Pacific, and Europe and a Standing Committee on Women
org-entry.stats: mems: 134 nat. orgs in 125 countries, representing about 45m. war veterans and war victims
org-entry.content-note: publ. Newsletter

address.verbatim-address: 1200 Harger Rd, Suite 330, Oak Brook, IL 60523, USA

org-entry.content-note: links executives in business and the professions, with the aim of advancing the status of women worldwide
carries out local and international projects
supports women's education and leadership
awards fellowship in various fields
International Convention held every 2 years (2022: Hamburg, Germany, in June)
org-entry.stats: mems: 30,000 in 1,200 clubs in 66 countries and areas
org-entry.content-note: publ. The Zontian (quarterly)
